basics.name: Zoher Kachwala
basics.label: PhD Candidate in AI/ML
basics.summary: PhD candidate advancing the capabilities of frontier Large Language Models to solve challenging real-world problems. My research improves core model performance in practical applications like semantic search and safe content generation through designing novel decoding strategies, developing robust evaluation pipelines for multimodal models, and building policy-aware moderation systems.

publications.name: Advanced Heuristics for LLM Decoding Improve Chain-of-Thought Reasoning
publications.abstract: Proposes novel decoding strategies guided by answer labels to improve chain-of-thought reasoning in LLMs, boosting interpretability and task performance in complex generation scenarios.

publications.name: Fine-Tuning Specialized LLMs for Large-Scale Community Content Moderation
publications.abstract: Building a real-world moderation system by developing a framework to fine-tune and deploy specialized LLMs; this work supports healthier online communities by predicting nuanced rule violations across 500+ subreddits.

publications.name: Task-Aligned Prompting Improves Detection of AI-Generated Images in VLMs
publications.abstract: Introduced a task-aligned prompting method (zero-shot-s$^2$) for VLMs that significantly improves zero-shot detection of AI-generated images (up to 29% F1 gain), demonstrating a simple and generalizable alternative to supervised models.

publications.name: REMATCH: Robust and Efficient Knowledge Graph Matching
publications.abstract: Introduced a novel AMR similarity metric (rematch) that is 5x faster than SOTA and improves semantic similarity by up to 5%, alongside a new benchmark (RARE) for evaluating structural similarity in knowledge graphs.

publications.name: A Multi-Platform Collection of Social Media Posts on the 2022 U.S. Midterm Elections
publications.abstract: Constructed and released a large-scale 30M-post dataset to support research in narrative analysis, information retrieval, and misinformation tracking.

publications.name: The Inexplicable Efficacy of Language Models
publications.abstract: Surveyed LLM capabilities across domains with focus on fine-tuning, generalization, and production trade-offs.

projects.name: Large-Scale Content Moderation with Specialized LLMs
projects.summary: Building a real-world system to support healthier online communities by fine-tuning and deploying specialized LLMs. The system provides large-scale, nuanced content moderation by predicting rule violations for over 500 subreddits.

projects.name: Text2Graph
projects.summary: Designed a system to extract graph-based representations from text, creating structured knowledge for knowledge-grounded reasoning in LLMs.

projects.name: Transformer Model Review
projects.summary: Conducted a literature review of various Transformer architectures (e.g., GPT, BERT) to survey their core mechanisms and capabilities.

work.name: Introduction to Network Science
work.summary: Led Python-based tutorials on real-world networks; emphasized GNN thinking and dynamic graph analytics.

work.name: Elements of Artificial Intelligence
work.summary: Designed autograders and provided support on search, logic, and reasoning modules for over 300 students.

work.name: Applied Machine Learning
work.summary: Assisted in PyTorch-based model development; emphasized reproducibility, inference validation, and tuning for deployment.

work.name: PricewaterhouseCoopers
work.summary: Supported enterprise data integrationâ€”focused on automation of validation pipelines and audit-ready logic modeling.
